pr_title: Android - Enrollment token trimmed before passing through api

timeline.message: Enrollment token trimmed before passing through api

timeline.bodyText:
is there a need to hardcode this here?
I would prefer if we left the choice to the server instead.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
@aswinijena100 what's the column size defined for enrollment token field?
@zohrehj it's a common practice to add field attributes such as min|max value, reg pattern, maxlength to restrict the user from entering invalid or long text.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

replies.bodyText: @zohrehj @dhanyak-btc Column size defined as 32 in the entity class , however token generation logic is defined with size 8 in participant manager datastore.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText:
I understand, however, these sort of hardcoding of parameters make future updates difficult; e.g. if we decide to increase the length of the token, Android User would need to update their app or they will get an incorrect message from the app.
If this is what we have for all other fields we can go ahead with this change for now, but ideally all validation logic should come from the same place (backend)/
replies.author: zohrehj
